name: Barbell Back Squat

instructions.description: Set a barbell in a squat rack at upper-chest height. Step under the bar and place it across your upper back (trapezius), gripping it slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Unrack the bar by standing tall, then step back with feet about shoulder-width apart and toes slightly turned out.
Brace your core and keep your chest up. Initiate the movement by pushing hips back slightly and bending knees.
Lower your body until thighs are at least parallel to the floor while keeping heels grounded and knees tracking over toes.
Drive through your heels and mid-foot to stand back up, extending hips and knees simultaneously.

performanceMetrics.notes: Select a load that allows proper depth and spinal alignment.
Lower reps for maximal strength; higher reps for hypertrophy.
Time under tension increases with slower eccentric phases.
Heart rate rises significantly during multi-rep or high-load sets.
Controlled breathing between reps; brace before descent.

commentsNotes: Keep spine neutral and avoid rounding the lower back.
Knees should track in line with toes throughout the movement.
Use a spotter or safety bars when lifting heavy loads.
Warm up with lighter sets before working sets.
